short_description: This is a driver function to build a adaboost model
long_description: The Adaboost_Drive function takes the entire data set as training input and builds an ensemble of weak classifiers from it

input_tables.name: AttributeTable
input_tables.description: Specifies the name of the table that contains the attributes and values of the data.
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the table that contains the attributes and values of the data.

input_tables.name: ResponseTable
input_tables.description: Specifies the name of the table that contains the responses (labels) of the data.
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the table that contains the responses (labels) of the data.

input_tables.name: CategoricalAttributeTable
input_tables.description: Specifies the name of the table that contains the names of the categorical attributes.
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the table that contains the names of the categorical attributes.

output_tables.name: OutputTable
output_tables.description: Specifies the name of the output table in which the function stores the predictive model it generates.
output_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the output table in which the function stores the predictive model it generates.

argument_clauses.name: IdColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the columns in the response and attribute tables that specify the identifier of the instance.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns in the response and attribute tables that specify the identifier of the instance.

argument_clauses.name: AttributeNameColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of attribute table columns that contain the data attributes.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of attribute table columns that contain the data attributes.

argument_clauses.name: AttributeValueColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of attribute table columns that contain the data values.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of attribute table columns that contain the data values.

argument_clauses.name: ResponseColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the response table column that contains the responses (labels) of the data.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the response table column that contains the responses (labels) of the data.

argument_clauses.name: IterNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of iterations to boost the weak classifiers, which is also the number of weak classifiers in the ensemble (T). The iterations must an INTEGER in the range [2, 200]. The default value is 20.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of iterations to boost the weak classifiers, which is also the number of weak classifiers in the ensemble (T). The iterations must an INTEGER in the range [2, 200]. The default value is 20.

argument_clauses.name: NumSplits
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of splits to try for each attribute in the node splitting. The splits must an INTEGER. The default value is 10.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of splits to try for each attribute in the node splitting. The splits must an INTEGER. The default value is 10.

argument_clauses.name: ApproxSplits
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to use approximate percentiles. The default value is 'true'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to use approximate percentiles. The default value is 'true'.

argument_clauses.name: SplitMeasure
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the type of measure to use in node splitting. The default value is 'gini'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the type of measure to use in node splitting. The default value is 'gini'.

argument_clauses.name: maxDepth
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the maximum depth of the tree. The max_depth must an INTEGER in the range [1, 10]. The default value is 3.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the maximum depth of the tree. The max_depth must an INTEGER in the range [1, 10]. The default value is 3.

argument_clauses.name: MinNodeSize
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the minimum size of any particular node within each decision tree. The min_node_size must an INTEGER. The default value is 100.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the minimum size of any particular node within each decision tree. The min_node_size must an INTEGER. The default value is 100.

argument_clauses.name: dropOutputTable
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to drop output_table if it exists. The default value is 'true'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to drop output_table if it exists. The default value is 'true'.

argument_clauses.name: OutputResponseProbDist
argument_clauses.rDescription: Switch to enable/disable output of probability distribution for output labels.
argument_clauses.description: Switch to enable/disable output of probability distribution for output labels.
